title: Drawing, "Door and Over Door, Blue (South) Drawing Room", 1815–22
medium: Pen and black ink, watercolor on white wove paper, silhouetted
creditline: Museum purchase through gift of Mrs. John Innes Kane
description:
Vertical rectangle. Design for the Royal Pavilion, Brighton. Design for a section of a wall, with double-doors bearing painted panels of lattice-work design and geometric pattern. The over door consists of a painting of Chinese figures in a landscape.

Original album associated with this collection still exists.  See 1948-40-1 accessory

tombstone.epitaph:
Drawing, "Door and Over Door, Blue (South) Drawing Room", 1815–22.
1815–22. Pen and black ink, watercolor on white wove paper, silhouetted. Museum purchase through gift of Mrs. John Innes Kane. 1948-40-60.
